books.title: Michael Strogoff
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: A courier of the Russian Czar must race against time and the Siberian elements to deliver a crucial message of an impeding Tartar invasion and possible treachery.

books.title: Seven Pillars of Wisdom
books.author: T. E. Lawrence
books.summary: T. E. Lawrence’s memoir of leading the Arab revolt against the Ottoman empire during World War I.

books.title: The Autobiography of Calvin Coolidge
books.author: Calvin Coolidge
books.summary: The thirtieth president of the United States recounts his life story.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Ozma of Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A girl gets whisked away to a fairy land and helps restore the proper rulers to the throne.

books.title: Kipps
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: An orphan raised by his aunt and uncle struggles as a young man to integrate into upper class society after receiving a substantial inheritance from his grandfather.

books.title: Short Plays
books.author: J. M. Synge
books.summary: A collection of three short plays by J. M. Synge.

books.title: The Water of the Wondrous Isles
books.author: William Morris
books.summary: A beautiful woman escapes a life of servitude under an evil witch to adventure through a series of magical islands.

books.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: A famous detective investigates a mysterious and apparently supernatural threat to the heir of a wealthy Dartmoor estate.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.summary: A tragic scientist creates a monster in his laboratory.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.

books.title: The Wisdom of Father Brown
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: Amateur detective and Catholic priest Father Brown solves mysteries in this second collection of Father Brown short stories.

books.title: The Conscience of a Conservative
books.author: Barry Goldwater
books.summary: A U.S. Senator and future presidential nominee outlines key principles of the 20th century American conservative movement.

books.title: Short Works
books.author: Epictetus
books.summary: A collection of Epictetus’s short works.

books.title: A Cycle of the West
books.author: John G. Neihardt
books.summary: A series of epic poems that recounts the history, legends, and mythology of the American West.

books.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A comedy skewering Victorian high society.

books.title: The Purple Cloud
books.author: M. P. Shiel
books.summary: A young adventurer embarks on a polar expedition, only to return to an unbelievably different world.

books.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective returns to London after having faked his death some years before, and investigates a series of baffling mysteries.

books.title: An Inquiry Into the Accordancy of War with the Principles of Christianity
books.author: Jonathan Dymond
books.summary: Dymond argues that war is incompatible with the teachings of Christianity.

books.title: The Innocents Abroad
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain travels abroad, offering witty observations on the places and cultures he encounters and commentary on the habits and foibles of his fellow travelers.
